title: Here's why you should opt for Apple's regular AirPods over the new $250 AirPods Pro
text:
Apple announced new AirPods Pro, which will cost nearly $100 more than regular AirPods.

They will go on sale October 30, and cost $250.

The new AirPods come with some features buyers have long been waiting for, like noise-cancellation, but regular AirPods are still the smarter buy.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Apple announced AirPods Pro on Monday, which will go on sale for $250 on October 30.

The new AirPods come with upgrades including noise-cancellation and water-resistance, features Apple fans have been asking for and other brands have incorporated into wireless headphones. They come in a wireless charging case and cost nearly $100 more than regular AirPods, which retail for $159.

Despite the upgrades, regular AirPods are still a smart buy. You'll get similar battery life and a more aesthetically appealing case, and wired charging is usually faster, anyway.

Here are the reasons you should stick with regular AirPods.
description: Apple's new AirPods Pro come with noise-cancellation and water-resistance, but they aren't necessarily worth an upgrade from regular AirPods.
